p: MMT-MTEtOH Cloisite C30B (C30B) is an organoclay derived from montmorillonite by modification with methyl, tallow (~65% C18; ~30% C16; ~5% C14), bis-2-hydroxyethyl and quaternary ammonium and was selected to improve the mechanical properties of chitosan-based films. It was obtained from Southern Clay Products (Gonzales, TX, USA) and it has 75% clay content, a moisture content of <2%, density of 1.98 g/cm 3, average particle size of 6 μm, basal spacing d 001 = 18.5 Å, and modifier concentration 90 meq/100g clay. It has two functional groups (hydroxyl groups and long alkyl chains linked with quaternary ammonium groups) [ 28] and it has been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for use in contact with food.
